org.ros.node
Interface Node

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultNode
public interface Node

A node in the ROS graph.

Nodes provide for communication with the ROS master. They also serve as factories for:

  • Publisher
    • ,
  • Subscriber
  • ServiceServer
  • ServiceClient
  • ParameterTree

Lifetime of any objects created from a node are controlled by the creating node.

Since:
Jun 20, 2011
Author:
Keith M. Hughes

Method Detail

getName

GraphName getName()
Returns:
the fully resolved name of this Node, e.g. "/foo/bar/boop"

resolveName

GraphName resolveName(GraphName name)
Resolve the given name, using ROS conventions, into a full ROS namespace name. Will be relative to the current namespace unless the name is global.

Parameters:
name - the name to resolve
Returns:
fully resolved ros namespace name

resolveName

GraphName resolveName(java.lang.String name)
See Also:
resolveName(GraphName)

getResolver

NodeNameResolver getResolver()
Returns:
DefaultNameResolver for this namespace.

getUri

java.net.URI getUri()
Returns:
the URI of this Node

isOk

boolean isOk()
Is the node ok?

"ok" means that the node is in the running state and registered with the master.

Returns:
True if the node is OK, false otherwise.

shutdown

void shutdown()
Shut the node down.

isRegistered

boolean isRegistered()
Poll for whether or not Node is current fully registered with MasterServer.

Returns:
true if Node is fully registered with MasterServer. isRegistered() can go to false if new publisher or subscribers are created.

isRegistrationOk

boolean isRegistrationOk()
Poll for whether or not registration with the MasterServer is proceeding normally. If this returns false, it means that the MasterServer is out of contact or is misbehaving.

Returns:
true if Node registrations are proceeding normally with MasterServer.

getMasterUri

java.net.URI getMasterUri()
Returns:
URI of Master that this node is attached to.

getCurrentTime

org.ros.message.Time getCurrentTime()
Returns the current time. In ROS, time can be wallclock (actual) or simulated, so it is important to use Node.getCurrentTime() instead of using the standard Java routines for determining the current time.

Returns:
the current time

getLog

org.apache.commons.logging.Log getLog()
Returns:
Logger for this node, which will also perform logging to /rosout.

newPublisher

<MessageType> Publisher<MessageType> newPublisher(GraphName topicName,
                                                  java.lang.String messageType)
Type Parameters:
MessageType - the message type to create the publisher for
Parameters:
topicName - the topic name, will be pushed down under this namespace unless '/' is prepended.
messageType - the message data type (e.g. "std_msgs/String")
Returns:
a Publisher for the specified topic

newPublisher

<MessageType> Publisher<MessageType> newPublisher(java.lang.String topicName,
                                                  java.lang.String messageType)
See Also:
newPublisher(GraphName, String)

newSubscriber

<MessageType> Subscriber<MessageType> newSubscriber(GraphName topicName,
                                                    java.lang.String messageType,
                                                    MessageListener<MessageType> listener)
Type Parameters:
MessageType - the message type to create the Subscriber for
Parameters:
topicName - the topic name to be subscribed to, this will be auto resolved
messageType - the message data type (e.g. "std_msgs/String")
listener - the MessageListener to be added to this Subscriber , will be called asynchronously any time that a message is published on the specified topic
Returns:
a Subscriber for the specified topic

newSubscriber

<MessageType> Subscriber<MessageType> newSubscriber(java.lang.String topicName,
                                                    java.lang.String messageType,
                                                    MessageListener<MessageType> listener)
See Also:
newSubscriber(GraphName, String, MessageListener)

newServiceServer

<RequestType,ResponseType> ServiceServer<RequestType,ResponseType> newServiceServer(GraphName serviceName,
                                                                                    java.lang.String serviceType,
                                                                                    ServiceResponseBuilder<RequestType,ResponseType> responseBuilder)
Create a ServiceServer.

Type Parameters:
RequestType - type for the request
ResponseType - type for the response
Parameters:
serviceName - the name of the service
serviceType - the type of the service (e.g. "test_ros/AddTwoInts")
responseBuilder - called for every request to build a response
Returns:
a ServiceServer

                                                                                    java.lang.String serviceType,
                                                                                    ServiceResponseBuilder<RequestType,ResponseType> responseBuilder)
See Also:
newServiceServer(GraphName, String, ServiceResponseBuilder)

newServiceClient

<RequestType,ResponseType> ServiceClient<RequestType,ResponseType> newServiceClient(GraphName serviceName,
                                                                                    java.lang.String serviceType)
                                                         throws ServiceNotFoundException
Create a ServiceClient.

Type Parameters:
RequestType - type for the request
ResponseType - type for the response
Parameters:
serviceName - the name of the service
serviceType - the type of the service (e.g. "test_ros/AddTwoInts")
Returns:
a ServiceClient
Throws:
ServiceNotFoundException - thrown if no matching service could be found

newParameterTree

ParameterTree newParameterTree()
Create a ParameterTree to query and set parameters on the ROS parameter server.

Returns:
ParameterTree with NameResolver in this namespace.

isRunning

boolean isRunning()
Is the node running?

A running node may not be fully initialized yet, it is either in the process of starting up or is running.

Returns:
True if the node is running, false otherwise.

getMessageSerializationFactory

MessageSerializationFactory getMessageSerializationFactory()
Returns:
the MessageSerializationFactory used by this node

getMessageFactory

MessageFactory getMessageFactory()
Returns:
the MessageFactory used by this node
